descr.p: "Twelfth Street Rag" was composed by Euday L. Bowman in 1914. It is one of the most famous and best-selling rags of the ragtime era. It has been recorded by many artists, ranging from Louis Armstrong to Lester Young.
The piano recording by Pee Wee Hunt was the Billboard number-one single for 1948, selling over three million copies. It was released as Capitol Records 15015 in May 1948.
Euday Bowman, the composer, recorded and published his own recording of the song, on Bowman 11748.
Its structure is: Intro A A1 Intro-2 A2
It has been best known as the theme to the Joe Franklin Show.
In the 1919 short A Day's Pleasure by Charlie Chaplin, the African-American band is heard playing a version of the popular rag while on the ship.
More modernly, a ukulele version has been featured as background music on the TV series SpongeBob SquarePants.
Rags and Ragtime, A Musical History, by David A. Janson and Trebor Jay Tichenor, 1978, Dover Publishing Mineola, NY
